bug.short_desc: Maemo permaorange in layout/style/crashtests/645951-1.html - can't drawWindow remote content

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=TraceMonkey/1302088733.1302090750.8095.gz&fulltext=1#err1 n900-gtk tracemonkey unit crashtest on 2011/04/06 04:18:53
REFTEST TEST-START | file:///builds/fennec/reftest/tests/layout/style/crashtests/645951-1.html REFTEST TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | | can't drawWindow remote content REFTEST INFO | WARNING: USE_WIDGET_LAYERS disabled REFTEST INFO | drawWindow flags = DRAWWINDOW_DRAW_CARET | DRAWWINDOW_DRAW_VIEW; window size = 800,480; test browser size = 800,1000 REFTEST TEST-START | file:///builds/fennec/reftest/tests/layout/style/crashtests/645951-1-ref.html REFTEST TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | | can't drawWindow remote content REFTEST TEST-PASS | file:///builds/fennec/reftest/tests/layout/style/crashtests/645951-1.html | image comparison (==)
I was out sick the day we covered remote reftests, so I don't know why it doesn't fail for Android (on the rare occasions when Android crashtests actually finish at all), but according to m.d.planning we may be moving the Mobile tests over to mozilla-central today, in which case this and bug 647984 will result in Maemo crashtests being hidden.
